cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 144 (Tuesday, September 17, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. CARAVEO:H.R. 9618.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Constitutional Authority--Necessary and Proper Clause (Art.I, Sec. 8, Clause 18)THE U.S. CONSTITUTIONARTICLE I, SECTION 8: POWERS OF CONGRESSCLAUSE 18The single subject of this legislation is:This bill will require the Director of the FederalInsurance Office to submit an annual report to the Presidentand certain Congressional committees with respect to theautomobile insurance industry,[Page H5318]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.title: Lowering Costs and Auto Rates for Insurance Act

To require the Director of the Federal Insurance Office to submit an annual report to the President and certain Congressional committees with respect to the automobile insurance industry, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
